LessonPart.title: Establishing a Potty Spot

lessonInfo.title: Explanation:
lessonInfo.text: Dogs thrive on routine, so one of the most effective methods to begin potty training is to establish a specific spot where your dog can go. This reinforces consistency and teaches them that thereâ€™s a designated area for relieving themselves.

list.step: Choose a potty area outside, ideally a spot away from where the dog plays.
Bring your dog to the potty area immediately after meals, naps, or play sessions.
Use a command like 'Go Potty' every time you take them there.
Praise and reward them with a treat when they go potty in the right spot.

LessonPart.Tip: Bring a toy or chew to the potty spot so your dog feels relaxed. This can help speed up the process.
LessonPart.Warning: Avoid changing the potty spot too soon, as this can confuse your dog and slow down their progress.
